p: Patients that fulfilled the selection criteria were studied from January to March 2016. The inclusion criteria were patients who arrived to Internal Medicine-Pediatrics outpatient clinics with acute febrile illness (greater than or equal to 38Â°C axillary temperature in the previous 7 days) along with one or more of the following symptoms: headache, muscle pain, retro-ocular pain, joint pain, nausea, low appetite, vomiting, dizziness, abdominal pain, diarrhea, chills, rash, photophobia, sore throat, cough, pallor, rhinorrhea, dyspnea, jaundice, cough, conjunctival injection, dysuria or convulsions. Exclusion criteria included patients with an identifiable source of infection, such as sinusitis, pneumonia, acute otitis media and acute upper respiratory tract infections, among others.
